headline: I had to make a big bet on a make-or-break 18 months. I later sold my company for $8 billion but first I had to dive deep into the ‘gray area’
summary: The tech CEO’s playbook includes big bets, hard choices and gut decisions.

headline: Why Intuit (INTU) Is Up After Raising Buybacks and Guidance—And What It Means for Shareholders
summary: Intuit Inc. recently reported fourth quarter and full-year financial results for the period ended July 31, 2025, highlighting US$3.83 billion in revenue for the quarter and US$18.83 billion for the full year, along with raised guidance for fiscal 2026 and an increased share repurchase authorization to US$14.5 billion. The company’s decision to also raise its quarterly dividend and announce robust future revenue and earnings targets points to growing management confidence and a firm capital...

headline: Proactive AI Customer Agent (2025): QuickBooks Recognized for Transforming Lead Management and CRM by Expert Consumers
summary: Expert Consumers recognizes Intuit's Customer Agent within QuickBooks as a milestone in how small and mid-sized businesses manage customer relationships and sales pipelines. Introduced as part of Intuit Assist's expanding ecosystem of generative AI capabilities, the Customer Agent illustrates how AI agents are moving from supportive assistants to proactive business partners.

headline: Intuit’s Q2 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: Intuit’s second quarter was marked by strong revenue growth and margin expansion, but the market reacted negatively to the results, reflecting concerns about the company’s forward outlook. Management attributed the solid performance to robust customer adoption of its AI-enabled business platform and new features in products like TurboTax Live and Credit Karma. headline: 2 Large-Cap Stocks to Target This Week and 1 That Underwhelm
summary: Large-cap stocks are known for their staying power and ability to weather market storms better than smaller competitors. However, their sheer size makes it more challenging to maintain high growth rates as they’ve already captured significant portions of their markets.
